attributes.action: let Australian and other Commonwealth countries practice Nursing in the UK
attributes.background: Let countries such as Australia be able to come to the UK and practice Nursing unlike the current law of only letting EU nurses practice with out having to re-training

attributes.action: Propose the EU a unified welfare system for unemployed  EU migrants.
attributes.background: European migrants, are attracted to Britain because of the generosity of its welfare system. If the EU shares common rights and laws for workers, then this should also include a common welfare system to stop the abuse of the welfare system and public resources in Britain.
attributes.additional_details: A unified welfare system would put a stop to the abuse of the British welfare system and public services from migrants, which is why so many people voted for BREXIT.

attributes.action: False statements and misrepresentation by politicians to be electoral fraud
attributes.background:
It is currently only counts as electoral fraud if a party makes a false statement about the character of a candidate.
Nobody is held to account for misrepresenting policies and outcomes in elections which is much more dangerous, leading people to vote based on false information.
attributes.additional_details:
Examples of this include:
The Vote Leave campaign claiming to spend £350 million a week on the NHS which was quickly denied the morning after the referendum.
Liberal Democrats wanting to rid students of tuition fees, but in a coalition government put fees up to £9000 a year.

attributes.action: Introduce points based system for citizens of non-neighbouring countries.
attributes.background: Introduce points based system for all prospective immigrants who are not citizens of our immediate neighbouring countries (Ireland, France, Iceland, Belgium, Netherlands, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Germany and Sweden. (List of countries to be debated.))

attributes.action: Allow students (12-16 age) to vote in the (second) EU Referendum
attributes.background: It's important for students to vote in the EU referendum  because it affects their life and their future life.They came here or born here for a better life (education+job) and they are more used to EU lifestyle
attributes.additional_details:
The pound rate has already gone down meaning UK will be badly financially affected.UK won't be able to trade in EU countries.Pupil from other European countries won't be able to migrate in UK and make our country proud.Example:Mo Farah,who is a migrant who made Britain PROUD.
Remember a quote from a girl "It's better to be part of something that is bigger than yourself" Would you like to be alone for your whole life or be with someone who will support you?
"Be safe and remain in EU"

attributes.action: Offer all pro-EU British citizens a grant to relocate to Europe.
attributes.background: Any current British citizen not wanting to live under UK governance should be offered a grant to relocate to an EU country. By doing so they forfeit forever all privileges afforded by the UK - such as free health care, pensions, disability benefits, social housing etc.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: Have the EU referendum for 28.8% that didn't vote, teens & British residents.
attributes.background: Only a quarter (26.74%) of Britain voted to LEAVE the EU. 28.8% registered voters, millions who couldn't register, 16-17 year old Brits, and UK residents, have had no say. Democracy is not a privilege of the few, and the EU referendum is incomplete and invalid currently & it must be completed.

attributes.action: In a 2nd EU referendum, only those whom did not vote initially may take part.
attributes.background: It is the only way which is fair.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: Hold a 2nd Referendum on the EU requiring all registered voters to cast a vote.
attributes.background: In the first vote only 37.44% of registered voters decided the long term future of the UK. This is not true Democracy.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Make voting compulsory for everyone over 16yrs and make sure its enforced.
attributes.background: I believe we should have a full and transparent view of our voting system, the voting for the EU referendum as a example why we should have a full view of every vote. 100% turn out and show a true scale of the votes so we dont have an issue with nearly half the country crying foul over non-voters
attributes.additional_details: EU Referendum - Massive outcry over voter turnout.

attributes.action: Increase the HM Government Petition Response and Action Commitment
attributes.background: We the undersigned call upon HM Government to recognise the scale of opinion over lawful and reasonable public interest matters with the provision of additional petition signature number milestones.
attributes.additional_details: It is proposed that a parliamentary debate is held for petitions achieving 1 million signatures and positive change is instigated for petitions achieving 10 million signatures.

attributes.action: Negotiate with EU to allow UK/EU passports to give full EU passage until expired
attributes.background: UK passport holders need the right of passage within existing EU territories using our UK/EU passport in the same way as we use Pre Referendum

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.

attributes.action: UK referendums to last a minimum of ten years, before repeating.
attributes.background: Scottish independence and EU referendum results to remain law for a minimum of ten years, along with any others which may follow.

attributes.action: Unite the country! An enquiry into the existing divide in the voting class
attributes.background: The UK on the 23rd June 2016 voted to leave the EU. The country had prior to, been subjected to scaremongering, distortion of facts and in general a politics filled with hate, divide and manipulation.
attributes.additional_details: In the aftermath of the vote, we awoke to a country on the verge on a breakup, with calls for a 2nd EU Referendum, a petition for the declaration of London's  independence and of course the call for a 2nd Scottish Referendum. We believe there is an urgent need for the UK Parliament to act and to prioritise the need to unite the country.We urge Parliament to examine the cause of the stark divide in society as reflected by the results of the EU Referendum by setting up a panel of enquiry.

attributes.action: Reduce sewage pollution on UK beaches - abolish OFWAT.
attributes.background: Every year millions of cubic meters of sewage laden waters end up in our rivers and on beaches. The current regulations are monitoring and reporting driven and fail to focus on proactive reduction of spills. OFWAT is a regulator that is obsessed with price reduction and fails to tackle this issue
attributes.additional_details:
The U.K. has a large number of beaches that are classified as having poor water quality and many others are inadequately monitored at all.
Sewage and hospital waste contained within are often found within shellfish and bathing water samples. All could be reduced through investment in storage capacity and real time control rather than the current monitoring.
We truly need to forget the political sensitivity of the price of water and allow price increases to permit investment

attributes.action: Give Bristol, Cambridge and other remain areas the chance to remain in the EU
attributes.background:
Scotland and London have significantly voted to remain. As such actions are being taken to protect their democratic decision. 

Other parts of the UK have also strongly voted to remain and in any devolution options should have the option to join the parts of the UK that choose to remain in the EU
attributes.additional_details:
Scotland are securing their right to have a 2nd referendum and London has a petition going strongly.

Certain areas and cities have overwhelmingly voted to remain in the EU, including Gibraltar, Northern Ireland, Manchester, Oxford, Brighton and more. These areas should not have their British identity stripped in devolution without choosing what their new identity will be.

attributes.action: Hold a Second EU Referendum for all 11 to 18 Year olds and combine the totals
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Vote held on Thursday 23rd of June 2016, was not democratic and failed to provide all people the vital information required to make an informed decision and most importantly failed to involve the most important people whose very futures depend on the vote

attributes.action: Create an online voting system using NI numbers as identication to vote
attributes.background: I believe that a better voting system would involve using the Internet as a platform as more people would come forward to vote as it has easier access and by using the NI numbers everyone with have a unique number in which to cast their vote.

attributes.action: Make discrimination against homeless people a lawfully recognised hate crime
attributes.background: A hate crime is defined in British law as an act of violence or hostility directed at someone because of who they are yet homeless people are not covered by this law. We want new legislation to further prosecute people who commit hate crimes against homeless people.
attributes.additional_details: One year 52% of homeless people suffered from violence (Source: Crisis). Whilst this in itself is a criminal offence it is not further punishable under the Criminal Justice Act 2003. We would also like to have police support and advice to be more widely available for homeless people. Many homeless people are afraid to report incidents to police and we would like change this.

attributes.action: Introduce a Code of Conduct for all political advertising.
attributes.background: Since 1999 party political advertising has been outside any code of conduct and is unregulated. The content of some written and broadcast material from both sides in the recent referendum would breach the Advertising Standards Authority's code of practice if it applied to political parties.
attributes.additional_details:
To maintain freedom of expression we propose the code of conduct be applied to all written material and to broadcasts where there is no immediate ability to challenge a statement.

We petition that all statements made in both written and broadcast material meet the following criteria:
Statements implied as fact should be truthful, evidence based and responsible and not misleading or inflame or incite fear or hatred.   Statements that are based on opinion should be clearly indicated as such.

attributes.action: Mandate gov't to create a non partisan advisory panel for the Brexit process
attributes.background: Mandate the government to create an independent advisory body of experts (across finance, business, politics, academia etc) to support and advise on the Brexit process - to ensure the best result for the British people. Advisory Council to represent all professional spheres.
attributes.additional_details:
On June 23rd 2016, the UK voting populace voted at the EU referendum to leave the European Union - with a simple majority of approx 52%. Following this, the Prime Minister has indicated he will step aside for a Brexit government to lead the country to invoke the leaving process.
A new government will require the support and expertise of a non-political advisory body, to bring the best research and knowledge in achieving the most beneficial Brexit for the British, EU and global populations.

attributes.action: The public to decide what 10 issues they want addressing and in which priority.
attributes.background:
So in a nutshell, a system which allows the people’s top 10 issues to be listed, prioritised and given measurable performance criteria with dated milestones for interim measurement.

These issues would be updated at each new election or after coming out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
All parties would have same top 10 KIP's which would give consistency and allow performance to be easily measured and compared by the average person.

Currently, all the different party manifestoes are complied by themselves and can’t be easily cross-referenced. This means performance measurement is not easy for the average person.

Obviously the parties they would have all the other issues which can be prioritised and outlined in their own way.

attributes.action: London, Northern Ireland and Scotland to leave the UK and remain in the EU
attributes.background: London, NI and Scotland all seem to be diverging socially, economically and politically from the rest of England.  Neither they nor the rest of England can in any way claim to represent each others views, so maybe it is time to split.

attributes.action: Use the EU referendum as a basis for a 2nd renegotiation of EU membership
attributes.background:
The EU referendum was a close call, only a difference of one million or so votes separated the opinions of nearly 34 million voters.

The first set of renegotiation weren't successful in the first place, thus, try again and with the added critical mass of this historical event - get a better deal.

attributes.action: Make it law for sun tan lotions to show the Uva star rating on the packaging
attributes.background: The uva star rating provides us with the broad spectrum cover that the sun cream gives us. The EU standard is 3 star but advice is given that we should be looking for a 4 or 5 star. Many brands do not publish what their rating is so the consumer can not make an informed decision when buying.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bad.org.uk/for-the-public/skin-cancer/sunscreen-fact-sheet

attributes.action: A new ONS prevalence survey into Children's and Young People's Mental Health.
attributes.background: Office of National Statistics prevalence surveys were carried out into Children and Young People's Mental Health in 1999 & 2004.  We have no equivalent up to date information.  There are indicators of a growing problem in the UK in this area.  A new survey would highlight the need for action.
attributes.additional_details:
House of Commons Health Committee, "Children's and Adolescent's mental health and CAMHS: Third Report of Session 2014-15", p17, http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm201415/cmselect/cmhealth/342/342.pdf
Chief Medical Officer, "Annual Report 2012: Our Children Deserve Better", ch10 p3, https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/255237/2901304_CMO_complete_low_res_accessible.pdf

attributes.action: Set aside parliamentary time to debate banning petitions.
attributes.background: Petitions are becoming the bane of our existence. Hardly a day passes without some irritant imploring us to support one in a vain attempt to get the Government to do something of very little consequence instead of spending precious parliamentary time on something of significance.

attributes.action: Scrap 9-1 GCSE's for the current year 10 (leaving in 2k17)
attributes.background: The current year 10 in the UK will have a mixture of letters and numbers for their GCSE's and they are having huge levels of pressure to complete the syllabus for english and maths on time and revise before sitting the exams.
attributes.additional_details: At some schools, students are stressing because they will not be able to study and revise well enough in the short period of time. If the 9-1 GCSE's are not running for the current year 10's 2k16, then it will reduce the stress of students not getting very high grades

attributes.action: Force retailers in airports and ports to pass on VAT/duty savings to consumers.
attributes.background: In 2015 it was exposed that many retailers in airports and ports do not pass on VAT savings to passengers travelling outside the EU and instead pocket the cash as extra profit. The government has failed to act on this issue costing consumers thousands. Retailers should pass on the full 20% saving.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-35197809

attributes.action: Introduce minimum professional qualifications for marketing services in the UK.
attributes.background: Considering the damage that poor advice or deliberate mis-selling of marketing services can do to our local & regional economies, it's time minimum professional qualifications were introduced to ensure protection for SME's across the UK. Greater accountability in marketing & advertising is required.

attributes.action: Make it the law for defibrillators to be at sports centres, schools, businesses
attributes.background: Earlier this year I went to a netball tournament as usual and during the match a friends mum dropped down in front of us and died, if there was a defibrillator at the sports centre she could've lived. This isn't good enough, we should go out of our way to keep lives safe. Make defibrillators the law
attributes.additional_details: Cardiac arrests and Sudden Adult Death affects everyone, no one is safe from this dreadful thing. Therefore I want to encourage all adults and young people to sign and give support to make a change!

attributes.action: Voting Results Transparency Through An Update of the Voting System
attributes.background: We call for an updated voting system, British people register once, when the time comes to vote they take a unique identifier with them to a local polling station where they can log onto an electronic terminal and submit their vote. The public should be able to view all the votes for transparency.
attributes.additional_details: Many will argue their anonymity will be breached through transparency, however this very anonymity has the potential to be used, to manipulate the general public to remain in a closed and unknown voting system, where the possibility of corruption of votes will remain. Transparency removes uncertainty and creates trust, a notion that perhaps will restore a small portion of much needed faith in our countries politics.

attributes.action: England to have a bank holiday every 1st Monday of every month.
attributes.background: We as a nation are overworked. We do not spend enough time enjoying the little things in life with the people that matter.

attributes.action: Present only balanced arguments to the public for country wide referendums
attributes.background: There are so many factors that go into something like the EU referendum and so many points of view, from infinitely many sources, that facts are lost/blurred in a "shouting match" between parties attempting to court our vote with ill or misinformed information.
attributes.additional_details: Using the EU referendum as an example again, we see too many "scare tactics" presented openly as "fact" by both leave and remain campaigners. This has led to many of us being left confused and feeling like we are backing the party with the loudest voice. I think one of two things would help everyone if another situation such as this should arise; either campaigns should always be presented with for AND against points equally or an independent analyst should present one document with all FACTS.

attributes.action: Increase winter fuel payments and make them taxable.
attributes.background: This is a universal benefit but is not paid to pensioners living in the EU. A precedent that this benefit is not universal but is paid on the basis of need. Thus it should be either taxed or means tested. It cannot be different rules for UK pensioners who choose to live in the EU.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a vehicle Driver or Passenger  to Smoke with a Window Down !
attributes.background: Drivers & passengers that smoke with a window down hold their cigarettes outside of the vehicle with ash & smoke going into the eyes/faces of following motorcycles, bicycles etc. This can blind people in following vehicles causing accidents & fatalities. This should be made illegal on safety grounds
attributes.additional_details:
People have been blinded on several occasions by moving vehicles/cars/vans & stationary hgvs by ash blown into thier eyes. 
Drivers appear oblivious to the impact of their actions on other road users. For a driver this is also effectively 'not in control of the vehicle' driving with one hand. The main problem is the holding of a cigarette outside the vehicle where the forward motion or wind carries the ash into the eyes of other road users. The way to enforce would be to ensure no external smoke

attributes.action: All Police to be equipped with Naloxone kits to save lives
attributes.background:
Naloxone is a medication used to block the effects of opioids, especially in overdose.

I have provided a link to show how many Police Departments in America carry Naloxone and times it has saved lives. 

http://www.nchrc.org/law-enforcement/us-law-enforcement-who-carry-naloxone/

attributes.action: Ban Spithoods in all UK Institutions and Police Stations
attributes.background: After watching a news article about Spithoods being used on people in Pokice Custody, I was incensed at the thought of such barbaric items being used in 21st Britain. It upset me so much that i felt the need to start this petition to get them banned altogether. Just the thought of them made me ill
attributes.additional_details: These could cause a fatality in some cases especially where people suffer from claustraphobia it coukd cause asthma patients to struggle to breath and the list goes on

attributes.action: Lower the cost or remove the cost of PRS & PPL Licensing
attributes.background: Many people over the years has been paying mega amount for a piece of paper that will allow you to create an online radio station. The costs per year vary from £545 - £2000. Myself and others think it should be removed in general. Let young people run a station without the fear of getting a fine!

attributes.action: Reduce funding for the BBC by the production cost of the new Top Gear.
attributes.background: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding.
attributes.additional_details: The new format of Top Gear does not show value for money for the UK TV Licence payer. The new format is focused on capturing the US market and the revenue it can receive. This is in effect is commercial TV and therefore should not have to be funded by the public purse. The BBC should then have the cost of the new format production reduced from it's annual funding until a UK audience based format is produced for the UK TV Licence payer.

attributes.action: Make councils turn redundant grace space they own into wildflower meadows.
attributes.background: Councils own lot's of patches of land next to roads, buildings  on housing estates etc; all that grows there is grass; it looks boring and the councils probably spend a fortune cutting the grass in the warmer months. Meadows are decreasing they need some help.

attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Parliament to change the law, to require the votes of MPs to be published.
attributes.background:
To stop MPs verbally stating their intention to vote one way but voting another.
Also, to highlight "tactical" voting and to give clarity to the electorate.

attributes.action: Raise tuition fees please.
attributes.background: Tuition fees are far too low and students are getting off easy. Please raise them!
attributes.additional_details: Raise them.

attributes.action: Stop motor insurers voiding innocent drivers' insurance policies
attributes.background: After a non-fault road traffic accident where my spine was injured, I received notice that my insurance was to be voided due to inadvertent (or innocent) non-disclosure of material fact.  The insurer could have checked the details for free at any time, but waited til I claimed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are multiple cases where the insurer is voiding policies after a claim is made.  My argument is that they are collecting "Golden Tickets", where they let you pay a policy until they are liable for something, so removing all risk

- They have a responsibility to check the details when it is free to do so.
- They shouldn't void insurance for trivial date mix-ups on policy, but rewrite/update instead.
- After non-fault incidents insurers shouldn't be allowed to throw the claimant to the wall.

attributes.action: Amend the law on stamp duty on your main residence when you own a second home
attributes.background: If you cohabit and separate and want to transfer the main residence to your sole name you have to pay 3% stamp duty on your equity share coupled with your portion of any remaining mortgage when you own a second property.  This law does not apply if you are married so discriminates people cohabiting.
attributes.additional_details:
Stamp duty was paid when the house was originally purchased so how can you pay this again when you are not moving?
Why does the rule not apply if you were to sell the property?
Why does being married mean you are exempt?
The revenue state this is because you are increasing your share of property you own?
Surely the additional stamp duty should only be on the increase in market value/equity of the property over and above what you originally paid?
